top_categories.workout_context: At 86 miles, Gran Fondo Strade Bianche punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
Racing Gran Fondo Strade Bianche isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s strade bianche (white roads), compacted clay demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
Gran Fondo Strade Bianche rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.

Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche' and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of Gran Fondo Strade Bianche. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche'.
Every session at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche intensity builds on this aerobic foundation — the endurance base is the soil everything else grows in.
Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s 6,560ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
High-volume endurance builds the aerobic base that makes Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s race-day efforts sustainable rather than destructive.

race_overlay.heat: March in Siena, Tuscany, Italy can bring heat. Complete 3–4 heat exposure sessions in the final 2 weeks before Gran Fondo Strade Bianche. Increase sodium intake 48 hours before race day.
race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for Gran Fondo Strade Bianche’s 86 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Gran Fondo Strade Bianche requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche' to build confidence. Expect: strade bianche (white roads), compacted clay, paved roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Durability, Race Simulation, and Gravel Specific to prepare you for 86 miles of compacted earth/clay with crushed stones—the famous 'strade bianche' in Siena, Tuscany, Italy.
